data.description: Data Scientist - Business AnalyticsNew York, NYMarkets and Subscriber Growth – Operations and Strategy /Permanent /On-siteApply for this jobWe are looking for a Data Scientist to join the Business Analytics team within Spotify’s Business Strategy and Insights organization. Our team tackles some of Spotify’s most consequential strategic questions, shaping the trajectory of our business and improving the experiences of our over 700M active users across more than 180 countries.In this role, you will use data analysis, experimentation, and statistical modeling to identify, assess, and launch a broad range of new initiatives and product features that span both product and business teams. You will also regularly assess the health of our business and identify areas of opportunity, translating these insights into clear, actionable recommendations for senior leadership.At Spotify, you'll have access to some of the richest datasets in the world and the autonomy to explore them creatively and rigorously. Above all, your work will shape how the world listens, discovers, and connects through audio.What You'll DoDevelop data-driven strategies to support the growth of Spotify’s active users and subscribers Create and communicate impactful findings and recommendations that improve the Premium productModel and forecast the impact of new business initiativesWork closely with business partners to understand the changes they are driving and help them discover new opportunities for growthAnalyze experiments (A/B tests; quasi-experiments) to measure the impact of new features and go-to-market initiativesPresent your findings to senior leaders, influencing the course of our businessWho You AreYou have 5+ years of professional experience in data science or analytics, ideally at a consumer tech company or top-tier consulting firm.You are fluent in SQL and Python or R, and have a strong grasp of statistical methods and causal inference. Direct experience with product analytics or experimentation is a plus.You enjoy partnering with a range of cross-functional stakeholders and working on varied projects involving different products and problem spaces.You have a strategic mindset and an eye for cleanly extracting the “so what” from complex, technical analyses.You are an excellent communicator adept at presenting to senior leadership and audiences of varying levels of technical knowledge.You are comfortable working through ambiguous, complex problems and don’t get discouraged when the path forward isn’t immediately clear.You hold at least a Bachelor’s degree in Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related quantitative field.Where You'll BeThis role is based in New YorkWe offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home.The United States base range for this position is $110,018 - $157,169, plus equity. The benefits available for this position include health insurance, six month paid parental leave, 401(k) retirement plan, monthly meal allowance, 23 paid days off, paid flexible holidays, paid sick leave. These ranges may be modified in the future.Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.We may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to support parts of the hiring process, such as reviewing applications, analyzing resumes, or assessing responses. These tools assist our recruitment team but do not replace human judgment. Final hiring decisions are ultimately made by humans. If you would like more information about how your data is processed, please contact us. Find our AI notice here: https://lifeatspotify.com/ai-noticeApply for this job
requirements: You have 5+ years of professional experience in data science or analytics, ideally at a consumer tech company or top-tier consulting firm.
You hold at least a Bachelor’s degree in Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related quantitative field.
responsibilities: Develop data-driven strategies to support the growth of Spotify’s active users and subscribers
We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home.
